alert.note: Alert for Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 2:26PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Natrona. * WHEN...Until 530 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 226 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall is expected. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Buffalo Creek, Sawmill Creek, Badwater Creek, Dry Fork Badwater Creek, First Water Creek, Baker Creek, Deep Creek, Sanchez Creek, Pine Creek, South Fork Buffalo Creek, First Water Draw, Hackett Creek, North Fork Buffalo Creek, Indian Creek, Cottonwood Creek and North Fork Cottonwood Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central Natrona County
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
